argument.name: position
argument.description: Can be one of the following values:

item.name: centered
item.description: Positions the window in the center of the viewport.

item.name: dock
item.description: Docks the window to a position specified by *[js:dockLocation]*. If position is "dock", you must define the *[js:dockLocation]*.

argument.name: dockLocation
argument.description: Defines the docked position. Only required if the first parameter, *[js:position]* is defined to be "dock". *[js:dockLocation]* can be one of the following values:

item.name: top
item.description: Window will be docked at the top of the screen.

item.name: bottom
item.description: Window will be docked at the bottom of the screen.

item.name: left
item.description: Window will be docked on the left of the screen.

item.name: right
item.description: Window will be docked on the right of the screen.

argument.name: relativePosition
argument.description: If specified, you must pass in a pointer to the 'parent' control, an element in the DOM, as the second parameter (*[js:ele]*) . *[js:relativePosition]* can be one of the following values:

item.name: dropdown
item.description: Window is opened below the 'parent' control. The left edge of the window is aligned with the left edge of the 'parent' control.

item.name: dropdown-right
item.description: Same as 'dropdown' option excep that the window's right edge is aligned with the right edge of the 'parent' control.

item.name: flyout
item.description: Window is opened to the right of the 'parent' control. The top of the window is aligned with the top of the 'parent' control.

item.name: flyout-bottom
item.description: Window is opened to the right of the 'parent' control. The bottom of the window is aligned with the bottom of the 'parent' control.

item.name: popup
item.description: Window is opened over the 'parent' control. The top of the window is aligned with the top of the 'parent' control.

item.name: popup-bottom
item.description: Window is opened over the 'parent' control. The bottom of the window is aligned with the bottom of the 'parent' control.

argument.name: ele
argument.description: Only requied if *[js:relativePosition]* is defined. Id of the 'parent' element that the window is positioned relative to.

argument.name: yPosition
argument.description: Defines the absolute y position of the window on the screen. Can be a numeric value defining the number of pixels or a string with a CSS units, eg: "100px", "2in", "10%".

argument.name: xPosition
argument.description: Required if *[js:yPosition]* has been defined. Defines the absolute x position of the window on the screen. Can be a numeric value defining the number of pixels or a string with a CSS units, eg: "100px", "2in", "10%".

page.discussion: Display a window. Takes optional arguments that control where the window is shown. If no arguments are specified, the window is shown in-view. If the window was previously shown, its last position is used if no arguments are specified.
